task_summary: Locate the T-shaped block and the fixed goal, align the circular tool to a side of the block, establish gentle contact, then execute a directed push toward the goal and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A table-top robot with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block into a marked target area. The contact sheet shows the arm approaching, touching the block, pushing it along the plane, and then withdrawing. The plan prioritizes reliable perception and alignment before a single continuous push. Control runs effectively at low latency, so short timeouts and minimal waiting are used. No grasping occurs; only planar contact, push, and retreat are required. A retry wrapper is used on the initial search to handle brief occlusions.
preconditions: Workspace clear except block and target
Table is planar and low-friction within expected bounds
stepwise_plan: Scan to detect the T block
Approach and align tool normal to intended push direction
Push the block a fixed distance toward the goal
success_criteria: Block pose overlaps the goal region within small tolerance
No loss of contact during the main push
End-effector retreats clear of the object and goal zone
failure_and_recovery: If the block is not found, rescan up to three attempts
If contact is not detected, re-approach and try again
If push distance is insufficient, re-align and perform an additional push
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after a successful push and retreat or after scan attempts are exhausted

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Raster scan to localize the T block with retries via decorator
Detect the fixed goal area or template
Approach the block and align push direction within tight tolerance
Orient tool yaw to match planned push direction
Move to a pose slightly offset from the block to begin push
Descend until contact to establish pushing contact
Back away to clear the workspace
Brief settle wait at the end

failure_modes: Object not detected due to occlusion or glare
Tool collides with table or object corner
recovery_strategy: Rescan using decorator and built-in attempts
Re-approach and realign then reattempt push
Perform an additional push with the same direction
Retreat and re-approach if unexpected contact occurs
assumptions: Color cues in frames differ from instruction: block appears red and goal mark blue; treated as symbolic identities
End-effector appears cylindrical but modeled as circular for contact
Push direction chosen at 90 degrees based on typical left-to-right table setup

expected_success_criteria: Final block pose overlaps goal marker within a small margin
No toppling or loss of contact during push
